page.title: 09West Southampton Schools 2
page.content: {Holy Family Roman Catholic First {and Middle School}is a state school situated on a large council estate at the western outskirts of{Southampton}. It is near the M271,and there is some farmland nearby. We interviewed the headmaster,Mr David Claise,who told us the school was opened by the Bishop of Portsmouth in 1975. It is a day school,and most of the pupils come by school bus from all parts of the city. There are{380 pupils}and{15 {teachers}. The largest class has 32 pupils while the smallest has 24. There is a school uniform. The school has a playing field, a library, swimming pool, one piano, two computers, a tv and video. Some huts are used as classrooms, showers after games are voluntary, and some homework is set.They do not have school discos.
